JunitServlet has changed it's name.

It is now called Cactus and can be found at:
http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/index.html

It is worth looking at it. It uses however
standard JUnit user interfaces such as the swingui.TestRunner.

JUnitEE is using an html-interface. As I already said it is on:
http://sourceforge.net/projects/junitee/

regards
Kaarle Kaila

--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> sramaswa007@y... wrote:
> 
> > Hi,
> >
> >   Is JUnitServlet an open source.  I checked the html pages from 
that
> > site and looks like they are running the tests from web site.  
Please
> > let me know.
> >
> 
> Yes, it's open source.  Again, it may not be an exact fit, but it's 
worth looking at as a starting point.  The documentation
> will have more information than I'm able to offer.
> 
> Mike
